content.description: A variation of Carnivore that continues left from the banana sidepull on mostly good holds, instead of heading straight out through the hueco. Feels anticlimactic but the moves are good.
content.protection: A few pads and a spot.
content.location: On the Anorexic Roof, this problem starts the same as Carnivore but finishes on the left side of the roof instead of straight out.

content.description: Start at the left end of Anorexic roof as per the finish of Meat Eater. Traverse the second half of Meat Eater in reverse and transition (with some trickery) into the second half of Anorexic. Finish as per Anorexic. This boulder is tough and quality!
content.location: Anorexic Roof, approx. 1 mile from parking.

content.description: The direct (and original) start to Carnivore. Begin at the skirt and make brutal moves through a small pocket and unlikely sloper to reach the pinch and banana hold on Carnivore. Finish the same, straight out through the circular hueco. Very powerful.

From the same start as Anorexic, climb through the small pockets to the rail, then head left to the large left-facing banana hold. Make a long move to the round hueco with thumb hole and move to the lip, head or feet first. Powerful and sustained on exceptional rock, one of the finest boulder problems anywhere.
content.protection: A few pads are good, along with spotters to keep you from going down head first.
content.location: On the Anorexic Roof, starts toward the right in the same place as Anorexic but trends left from the rail and exits through the lone head-sized pocket.

content.description:
Start carnivore direct, after the big dyno, climb right and finish out the BK Broiler.  

vimeo.com/34520160
Start as for anorexic, attain the rail and climb straight out the roof through pinches to crux move near lip
content.protection:
2-3 pads with proper placement helps.  

vimeo.com/39504086

content.description: classic priest draw roof problem.  start on two pockets on the center wall of the cave then reach for shallow 2 finger pockets on roof.  climb roof out right (crux) to lip and up to topout.

Jutting straight out of the hillside and exposed on three of its sides, Anorexic Roof is one of the most striking formations at the Draw and contains two of its best-known problems, Anorexic and Carnivore. Solid and beautifully featured rock, a great landing, and some powerful, classic problems make this one of the most popular roofs in the area.
